meanings.definition: A building or outdoor area where plays, movies, or other dramatic performances are presented.
meanings.sent1: We went to the theatres to watch a funny play.
meanings.sent2: The local theatres are showing a new movie this weekend.
meanings.sent3: The theatres were filled with laughter and applause.
meanings.sent4: Her life was a series of theatres, each scene more dramatic than the last.
meanings.sent5: The neon lights of the theatres lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: The activity or profession of acting in, producing, directing, or writing plays.
meanings.sent1: She studied theatres in college to become an actress.
meanings.sent2: His passion for theatres led him to pursue a career in theater.
meanings.sent3: The theatres in town were buzzing with talented actors.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, negotiations can sometimes feel like theatres.
meanings.sent5: The art of theatres requires dedication and creativity.

meanings.definition: The area of a hospital where surgeries are performed.
meanings.sent1: The patient was wheeled into the theatres for the operation.
meanings.sent2: Doctors and nurses work together in the hospital theatres.
meanings.sent3: The theatres in the hospital are equipped with advanced technology.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet of the night, the hospital theatres never sleep.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights in the theatres signaled the start of a life-saving procedure.
